usefulItems: round cake tin (Ø 20 cm), long sharp knife, wire rack, refrigerator, oven
title: Lavender Shortbread

ingredients.content: 130 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting

preparations.content: Place lavender and 25 g sugar in mixing bowl then grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place rice in mixing bowl and grind <b>30 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to bowl with lavender sugar and set aside.
Place butter, remaining 30 g sugar and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.

Add flour then reserved lavender sugar and ground rice. Mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Press evenly into a round cake tin (Ø 20 cm).
Score into eight with a sharp knife then prick with a fork. Place in fridge for 15 minutes to firm up. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 150°C.

Bake for 30 minutes (150°C) until cooked through and lightly golden. Sprinkle with Demerara sugar then set aside to cool completely. Remove from tin and serve or store in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

hintsAndTricks: For a plain shortbread, omit lavender.
Different flavoured sugars can also be used such as vanilla or rosemary.
For a citrus twist, add finely grated zest of 1 lemon or 1 orange.

These buttery, crumbly biscuits are strongly associated with Scotland where they originated. We’ve added a twist here with a subtle lavender flavour. Lovely with a cup of tea, or served on the side of a lemon posset.
